lexUnit.name: charm.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: impress with one's personal attractiveness

sentence.text: They were hot and prickly to wear , and impossible to keep clean , but they charmed the child so thoroughly that she was content to sit as still and silent as a doll eyeing the dazzling frills and listening to the faint crackle of the underskirts .
We have charmed each other with our weaknesses .
In a sense , he could charm the birds from the trees , because he adopted and tamed a variety of wildlife .
Bella married a butcher who displayed her photographs in his shop while she charmed the customers in the same way she had charmed the stars .
` Charm a man into insanity , " he concluded .
He is at present looking more angelic than ever , trying to charm his mother into letting him have his own way ! "
We 'll see him if he is and not if he is n't , " he said with a relaxed informality that charmed her .
If he had held a door open for a Viennese woman she would have charmed him .
` Go to meet him with Maggie and let her charm him . "
Instead Ven inclined his head a fraction in her direction and , keeping his face straight , drawled drily , ` You , Fabia , certainly know how to charm a man . "
What he told me was that M. Chaillot adored the company of women and would wish to charm me .
But behind closed doors , only months after she charmed New York , she was allegedly pouring out a mixture of misery and banal chat on the phone to a male admirer .
So often compelled to be distant , at close quarters she is frank , informal , funny , direct and possessed of an uncanny ability to charm the least star-struck .
The young people who have caught the madness of war are , in fact , prisoners of this old men 's mentality which has charmed them .
He was charmed by his thoughts , charmed by the look of his new village , like a doll 's house with the front enticingly shut .
He is still terrible enough for us to fear him yet subtle and cunning enough for us to be charmed by him .
But for now at least , this is one group of children who 've definitely been charmed by snakes .
Best 's skills mesmerised defenders and charmed the fans but his lifestyle attracted the press , the police and the parasitic attention of the Creatures who thrive on the back of stardom .
All the arrangements for stay-behind agents in north-west Europe collapsed , but Dansey was able to charm most of the governments in exile in London into recruiting spies .
" He 's charmed her as he has everyone else--and she loves the horses , of course .
Seductive country , then , to charm a young London schoolteacher away from the semi-rural but crowded northern suburbs of the capital .
Later , much later , when I 'd refused at least seventeen attempts to ply me with drink , I found myself sitting at dinner , attempting to charm the ruling monarch 's fourth child .
He was always welcome , charming his mother and talking business with his father .
In Paris yesterday Diana charmed officials and crowds .
He had been able to charm more than a few elderly ladies in his time .
Fearful at first of the reunion , Katherine found herself charmed by her aunt , who reminisced comically about Jacob 's youthful exploits .
He charmed , teased , involved then abandoned , his mind already on the next thing .
